title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 21 October 2016 - XWiki
content:
<jonesmeier> has quit  
03:23 <jonesmeier> has joined #xwiki  
08:11 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:33 <Aranjedeath> has quit  
08:51 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:18 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
10:14 <Pbas> Hello, I'm a total newbie onmaven stuff. I launch mvn xar:format but this command didn't going at the end. batch failed when trying to download:  http://nexus.xwiki.org/nexus/content/groups/public/com/google/gwt/gwt-user/2.7.0/gwt-user-2.7.0.jar  
10:14 <Pbas> On my browser (through proxy server) => Une erreur est survenue en exécutant une  opération ICAP : Maximum total files in archive exceeded; File:  gwt-user-2.7.0.jar; Sub File: ; Vendor: Sophos, Plc.; Engine version:  
10:17 <Pbas> I just noticed that my proxy server fault :-/  
10:17 <Pbas> must check if it is our anti-virus on it or other filters...  
10:19 <tmortagne> Pbas: the error seems to suggest you just don't have enough place left  
10:20 <Pbas> on ou proxy ?  
10:20 <Pbas> on our proxy?  
10:20 <tmortagne> no idea, just reading the error you pasted which is talking about "Maximum total files"  
10:21 <tmortagne> or maybe it just does not want to open big zip files  
10:21 <tmortagne> I guess it's analyzing what's in it  
10:21 <Pbas> agree.  
10:22 <Pbas> with have an anti-virus canning downloaded file and when the file is too big ... :-(  
10:26 <Pbas> "Vendor: Sophos, Plc.; Engine version: " mean it is our main anti-virus on proxy :-(  Crap!  
10:28 <acotiuga> has joined #xwiki  
10:30 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:31 <tmortagne> Pbas: I guess what you can do is get this file by other means and install it in your local Maven repository  
10:32 <Pbas> yes, I must know where to drop file  
10:32 <tmortagne> see https://maven.apache.org/guides/mini/guide-3rd-party-jars-local.html  
10:33 <tmortagne> this will put the file where Maven usually downloads it  
10:33 <tmortagne> then it will keep using it instead of trying to find it online  
10:34 <Pbas> Ok thxs, I will try mvn install:install-file -Dfile=<path-to-file> ... when I'm coming home to download the file  
10:37 <tmortagne> Pbas: get the jar and the pom.xml files  
10:37 <Pbas> ha good to know :-)  
10:38 <tmortagne> pom.xml file is the descriptor, contains dependencies and stuff  
10:38 <tmortagne> (don't remember if this one has much in its pom.xml but always safer)  
10:39 <Pbas> I must steal a 4G phone now  
10:39 <tmortagne> actually in the repository it will look like a .pom file  
10:39 <Pbas> yes this one I can open it  
10:39 <tmortagne> actually Maven probably downloaded it already  
10:39 <tmortagne> so indeed the jar might be inough  
10:39 <tmortagne> enough  
10:42 <Pbas> ok thxs :)  
11:17 <Pbas> ", maven failed when he try to doanload again same file from internet  
11:17 <Pbas> I have this error: [ERROR] Failed to execute goal on project xwiki-platform-gwt-dom: Could not resolve dependencies for project org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-gwt-dom:jar:8.4-SNAPSHOT: Could not transfer artifact com.google.gwt:gwt-dev:jar:2.7.0 from/to xwiki-releases (http://nexus.xwiki.org/nexus/content/groups/public): Failed to transfer file: http://nexus.xwiki.org/nexus/content/groups/public/com/google/gwt/gwt-dev/2.7.0/gwt-dev-2.7.0.jar. Return code is: 5  
11:24 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:26 <Pbas> mvn -o xar:format (offline) failed too. Sorry I must check if I downloaded correct file. hé hé  
11:28 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
11:28 <vmassol> has quit  
11:29 <Pbas> gwt-dev missing now (gwt-user previous) grrr!  Play again!  
11:34 <evalica1> has joined #xwiki  
11:36 <evalica> has quit  
11:40 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:43 <evalica1> has quit  
13:41 <D-Spair> has quit  
13:50 <D-Spair> has joined #xwiki  
15:08 <tmortagne> has quit  
15:13 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
15:48 <Pbas> Hello, about my PR: https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/pull/543/files I need to create a jira issue? (my PR is only a little addon on xwiki syntax guide)  
15:57 <tmortagne> Pbas: I don't think a jira issue is required for this, I just added a little comment  
15:57 <Pbas> Pfiou jira issue is not required

17:53 <Denis> has quit  
18:06 <dmd\_> has joined #xwiki  
18:06 <dmd\_> is now known as <dmd->  
18:06 <dmd-> (a) Is there a way to get the GUID of a page via REST?    (b) Are GUIDs stable if a page is renamed?  
18:07 <dmd-> Basically I want to be able to create a page via REST, and then have a stable reference to it.  
18:31 <mflorea> has quit  
18:47 <tmortagne> has quit
